data.title: The Prime Meridian divides the globe into Eastern and Western hemispheres.
data.text:
The Prime Meridian divides the globe into Eastern and Western hemispheres, just as the equator divides the globe into Northern and Southern hemispheres. The Prime Meridian is at 0 degrees longitude, just as the equator is at 0 degrees latitude.

The Prime Meridian

in Greenwich, England

National Maritime Museum

Latitude: 51.5°N

Longitude: 0.0°

Time and Longitude

Use a time zone map to locate the Prime Meridian and Greenwich, England.

How far east or west of the Prime Meridian do you live (in degrees)?

What is the time difference (in hours and minutes)?

Facts to Remember

Greenwich, England is the reference point you will use for measuring time.

The Prime Meridian is the reference line you will use for measuring longitude.
